subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] for Kay
author: bruce halliday

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Kay,
 
In my experience, our friends on the other side welcome new researc=
hers with open arms.
They tell me almost every session that it is vital for=
 the advancement of the communication to get the word out and 
bring in and=
 teach new researchers. The more positive and strong flow of energy the str=
onger the bridge becomes.
 
With each new researcher comes their individual=
 spiritual energy that is then incorporated into the collective energy of a=
ll involved, spirit
and physical alike.
 
So you can rest assured they are =
not apprehensive about communicating with you. But they may feel some of yo=
ur concern or apprehension 
about your ability to communicate with them.
 
=
It takes a little while for your hearing to become accustomed to the sound =
of a box and to be able to sift through the clutter to hear the spirit mess=
ages.
 For some it comes quicker than others. If you trust in yourself and =
believe you do have a place in this spirit communication.
Our friends on th=
e other side will do all they can to make sure you receive their messages.
=
 
I suggest you do short sessions consisting of simple questions that can b=
e answered in one or two words. this will help to train your ear 
to hear a=
nd understand the real time communication.
Do not get discouraged, our frie=
nds are there and they will guide you and we are always here to help. I hav=
e never heard of anyone 
walking away from box research because they did no=
t get any communication. give it time it will come.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday =



To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: psfponies@...: Mon, 31 Mar 20=
08 13:33:19 -0700Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] for Kay





Thanks Bruce 
 
I am s=
ure my email got lost in the shuffle. I do appreciated you offering to be s=
o helpful to us newbies. 
 
So far I seem to have got my questions answered=
 from the list members. 
 
I am just waiting to for someone to come through=
 and talk to me. I havent done to many sessions yet just a few test ones. I=
 feel them there lurking maybe they are waiting to make sure it is safe to =
talk to me.
 
Kaybruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote=
: 
Kay, If I overlooked your e-mail. Please forgive me.I get so many a day,=
 some times a couple get lost in the schuffle. I you resend it I wiil be ha=
ppy to answer any questions you have. bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.comFrom: psfponies@...: Sun, 30 Mar 2008 18:00:31 -070=
0Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_can anyone help ?



The invitati=
on isn't much good if you don't get back to people who email you!
 
Kaybruc=
e halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:
Maragaret, The reas=
on I extend an invitation to new people to contact me off group if they wis=
h,Is for two reasons, the first most new people tend to be shy and reserved=
 and intimidated when it comes to asking public questionsmost feel that the=
ir questions may be viewed as silly or not deserving of serious explination=
. I have encountered many instances like this.It just helps them to take th=
e first couple of steps if they feel they are in a confidential environment=
. Also, I tend to be very long winded in my responses and answers with expl=
inations, and I don't think that the more experienced members here that hav=
e heard it all before care to hear a three paragraph post on why you should=
 use the 470 instead of the 469. I am always available on and off board to =
answer any and all questions I am able. Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.comFrom: ITCdeadpeople@...: Sun, 30 Mar 2008 22:18:57 =
+0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_can anyone help ?


Hi Bruce. Jus=
t a thought.... It's really sweet of you to make yourself so available to p=
eople, but if you have members take inquiries of this nature off the boards=
 by having them contact your privately, you are limiting the amount of lear=
ning that can take place. There are likely "lurkers" here, who will never j=
oin or come forward, but could really benefit from Lyn's questions and the =
answers she receives from the group. Taking communication privately also el=
iminates the possibility for her to receive multiple opinions. (not to impl=
y there isn't a time for privacy!) ;0)Like I said, just a thought. Margaret=
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...=
> wrote:>> > Lyn,> > I would be happy to help you and answer any questions =
you have.> you can e-mail me if you like> > paranormalinvestigating@...> > =
any time> Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: ITCdeadpeople@...: S=
un, 30 Mar 2008 20:09:51 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_can anyo=
ne help ?> > > > > Hi Lyn. I'm sure several of us here could help you. What=
 are your questions? Margaret--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Lyn" <angels4=
lyn@> wrote:>> HI> I'm one of the quiet members here. trying to learn from =
everyone.> I have activity in my home. so I purchased an RCA digital record=
er> which is amazing.> I have captured several EVPs, some quite clear, some=
 a bit too fast> so I slow it down to hear it. some are voices , some answe=
r questions, some > are just noises.> > does anyone have experience with EV=
Ps on digital recorders ?> I have a ton of questions... and need advice on =
some of them.> > thanks> Lyn> angels4lyn@> > > > > > > > __________________=

Kay,<BR>
 <BR>
In my experience, our friends on the other =
side welcome new researchers with open arms.<BR>
They tell me almost every =
session that it is vital for the advancement of the communication to get th=
e word out and <BR>
bring in and teach new researchers. The more positive a=
nd strong flow of energy the stronger the bridge becomes.<BR>
 <BR>
Wi=
th each new researcher comes their individual spiritual energy that is then=
 incorporated into the collective energy of all involved, spirit<BR>
and ph=
ysical alike.<BR>
 <BR>
So you can rest assured they are not apprehens=
ive about communicating with you. But they may feel some of your concern or=
 apprehension <BR>
about your ability to communicate with them.<BR>
 <=
BR>
It takes a little while for your hearing to become accustomed to the so=
und of a box and to be able to sift through the clutter to hear the spirit =
messages.<BR>
 For some it comes quicker than others. If you trust in =
yourself and believe you do have a place in this spirit communication.<BR>
=
Our friends on the other side will do all they can to make sure you receive=
 their messages.<BR>
 <BR>
I suggest you do short sessions consisting =
of simple questions that can be answered in one or two words. this will hel=
p to train your ear <BR>
to hear and understand the real time communication=
.<BR>
Do not get discouraged, our friends are there and they will guide you=
 and we are always here to help. I have never heard of anyone <BR>
walking =
away from box research because they did not get any communication. give it =
time it will come.<BR>
 <BR>
Bruce<BR><BR><BR>
